intro: Orobus macrorrhizus, commonly known as the large-rooted orobus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its robust, fibrous root system, which contributes to its name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, usually ranging in color from white to pale pink. Orobus macrorrhizus is adapted to a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, fertile ground.
